answers.author: Derek Johnson
answers.text:
Hi Leslie, 
I would recommend contacting someone at ICMA's Center for Performance Measurement. They may know about some resources that may be helpful to you. 
Center for Performance Measurement 
http://icma.org/en/results/center_for_performance_measurement/home
cpmmail@icma.org
202-289-4262
In addition, I have attached to this answer a study done by the Alfred P. Sloan foundation regarding nine municipalities in Iowa that experimented with "citizen initiated performance assessments" (CIPA) in 2001. Based on how helpful the study is, it may be worth following up with the foundation or the individual cities and towns involved in the study to see if the program is still active and how useful they found it. Contact Dr. Paul Coates at 515-294-1844 or paulc@iastate.edu. 
I would also check out this page of their website, as it seems to contain examples and contact information for a few other citizen-based performance measurement studies: 
http://www.seagov.org/sea_gasb_project/sloan.shtml
Hope this was helpful. Good luck with your search.

answers.author: Louise Snyder
answers.text:
Hi Leslie-You might also check out the website of Casper, WY. Casper created the OneCent Project, an online survey asking citizen’s to rank relevant projects to determine their priorities for the coming year.  Also, check out the EugeneCounts program in Eugene, OR, which collected citizens' opinions regarding city priorities. I wish you well with you research.

author: Leslie Beauregard
text:
City Council has asked that staff convene a group of citizens to revew the City's scorecards and performance measures before we make them public.  We have been working on these for many years now and this is kind of the final push.  Has anyone else done something similar and have any suggestions on how to make this as useful and successful as possible?  
Thanks!
Leslie Beauregard
title: Citizen Workgroup to Review Department Scorecards and Performance Measures
